website_summaries.verdict: Great travel rod in 4 pieces with a carrying pouch. Very good price point for a versatile fishing rod.
pros: Premium cork grip on handle for comfort
Works great for a variety of fishing locations and use cases
cons: It's a little heavy for casting all day
Rod may break if you catch a heavier than expected fish

customer_reviews.title: very nice rod
customer_reviews.text: This 7 1/2 foot FibLink is the match to my 6 1/2 foot FibLink . both 4 piece travel rods are of really nice quality and they have very good feel. I matched them up with nice reels. Compared to other travel rods, these win hands down for quality of graphite and eyes and reel seat. The cork handles are of excellent quality. They fit in my suit case easily for travel to go Bass fishing on Table Rock or casting for ocean critters in Oahu. These are the best Travel rods with the worst name ! :>)
customer_reviews.author: Patsy K.

customer_reviews.title: The rod itself appears to be good quality but the tip eye broke off
customer_reviews.text: The rod itself appears to be good quality but the tip eye broke off... May have been defective from installing. I'd like another replacement top section if possible. Hopefully the company will just send me that but I did start the return process. Got a reply from company itself and the rod has a 1 year warranty as per my email.. They're very responsive and helpful and today I sent in emailed pics of issue and they will send me a replacement top section. Will update as things change.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Handshy

customer_reviews.title: Best Rods for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have the spinning rod and it landed several big Salmon and it fits nice in a standard suitcase. This year I treated myself to the casting rod and it landed some big Lakers. I am very happy with both Rods and you get a lot of bang for the buck. I can say you should treat yourself to both Rods for less than $100.
customer_reviews.author: rlp review

customer_reviews.title: Ordered Baitcasting rod.. received Spinning rod
customer_reviews.text: So they sent the wrong style of rod that I ordered.. OK.. it happens... But.. I do have to give this Spinning rod a thumbs up! It is of decent quality and is both very lightweight and has decent spine! I'll still use it rather than hassle with a return.. but I may order the baitcasting rod too!
customer_reviews.author: SFC McGan

customer_reviews.title: Great Rod, One Wish
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rod. It goes together quickly and has a strong back bone once put together. One thing I wished was better and is the only real thing, is the travel case/sleeve. Although it seems like it will do the job for preventing scratching, it leaves room for improvements in impact resistance area. I repeat this is my only wish, everything else is great quality and great construction. I would recommend this rod for any type of travel fiahing.
customer_reviews.author: cameron jones

customer_reviews.title: the rod feels very light which is nice, but it is virtually impossible to cast with ...
customer_reviews.text: the medium heavy is stiffer than a fence post.... the rod feels very light which is nice, but it is virtually impossible to cast with unless you have a lot of weight on your line.. like half an ounce at least...the rod has virtually no play in it... i have deep-sea trolling rods that have more play than this little thing.... i would return it if i could....
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: I really love the weight and sturdiness of this rod
customer_reviews.text: I really love the weight and sturdiness of this rod. I was actually challenged by a huge stingray to my surprise this rod held its weight. I even bought one for another family member and he too is impressed with the performance. I would recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: verna thompson

customer_reviews.title: Good sensitivity, but fragile
customer_reviews.text: Broke in multiple places, but it was probably my fault. Should have been more mindful that these are more fragile than the 1 piece rods I'm used to. Great sensitivity for a 4 piece and caught lots of smallies. I also have the spinning version, but it hasn't broken yet.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L.

customer_reviews.title: Sensitivity vs portability
customer_reviews.text: This thing is my new favorite pole. Fits in my pack so I don't have an "antenna" that gets snagged on everything while I'm getting to my spots. Pretty solid feel and action. It's fair on the sensitivity, but you'll lose something when you get away from a one peice pole.
customer_reviews.author: Christine R Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: When fishing, my lure got stuck in a low hanging tree branch. A few tugs, and the top pieces disconnected and fell in the water. Also they claim there is a one year warranty. Reached out twice to see if I could get a replacement rod, and have been ignored both times. Would not recommend purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Amazing what these things can handle.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the bait caster model last year for Belize. This year I bought the spinning rod. These rods landed several 30 lb tarpon, a monster barracuda, numerous reef fish and some jacks. We were using 30 lb braid and put a lot of pressure on these rods and they held up. I had three friends with me and we all purchased them for the trip and they all held up to quite a bit of abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome travel rod for the price point
customer_reviews.text: Awesome travel rod for the price point. I used it to catch stripers in Mass. On vacation and bass in the local pond. The action on the 6'6" is really about perfect imo. I paired it with an Abu Garcia black max reel and 30lb braid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good rod for the money.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for with this rod. For 40 bucks it’s great. It bends a bit further down the blank than most medium fast actions but it still has a fairly stiff backbone. All the joints held tight and it was as sensitive as a 50-80 dollar rod. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S.

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice and has a cork handle
customer_reviews.text: I got the 7ft version. It breaks down to less than 2ft pieces and comes in a soft tent type bag. It's a bit stiff but this is a $40 travel rod. It looks nice and has a cork handle. For what it is. A $40 travel rod it's perfect. If I expected a hard case and great action I would have planned on spending $100 +
customer_reviews.author: cuda

customer_reviews.title: Great travel rod!
customer_reviews.text: It can keep a fish pinned and get it in the boat. Really shines with crankbaits with sharp trebles and suits its purpose well as a backup or travel rod. I wouldn't use it as my only rod however, opting instead for a more sensitive rod that is better for all around fishing, including plastic baits.
customer_reviews.author: Rayzor

customer_reviews.title: Rod snapped on its first cast
customer_reviews.text: Took it on it’s first outing and first cast with it and it snapped throwing a 1/4 oz lure. Really wanted to like this rod but didn’t turn out the way I expected to.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Rod for the price and convenience....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to take on a trip to Orlando. I was a little hesitant with the four pieces I thought I would lose some strength and feel. I was totally wrong this rod is amazing! For the price point it's a no-brainer it fits in my four piece fly rod tube and has great backbone.
customer_reviews.author: Montierth Tribe

customer_reviews.title: looks good, convenient, but ...
customer_reviews.text: This rod was great as long as I wasn't catching fish. 4 pieces: very convenient for Fisher Biker man like me, very light, BUT the top part broke at the first fish it had to retrieve. The vendor just contacted me and offer me to replace that broken piece. I will keep updating this review.
customer_reviews.author: GERALD BLONDEL

customer_reviews.title: Broke within minutes! Give my money back!
customer_reviews.text: The rod tip broke off during the first use of the pole. I have a 7’1” MH casting rod. $50 and waiting a week just to be disappointed within minutes of use. I do not recommend this product although i wish i could. No number for any sort of customer support. I want my money back!
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected even.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rod especially for the price, it's very light but sturdy. Solid construction that fits together great and has enough backbone for solid hook sets while still being sensitive enough to feel the bites. I would say this rod is easily on par with some of the $100+ Travel rods.
customer_reviews.author: D Walker

customer_reviews.title: The rod power is less than described. Buy a ...
customer_reviews.text: The rod power is less than described. Buy a heavier power if you are expecting comparable power to a one piece rod.
customer_reviews.author: markletsfish

customer_reviews.title: I caught multiple 5 lb bass with the rod it worked great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rod to take on a trip to central Florida. I caught multiple 5 lb bass with the rod it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Fiblink!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my Fiblink 4 piece travel rod so far. It is very stiff and durable which is a quality I like for the techniques I often use. I used this rod on a recent vacation and it preformed well. I would reccomend the Fiblink 4 piece travel rod to anyone that likes to fish out of state or any other far destination for fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great rod!
customer_reviews.text: Love this rod! It’s perfect for traveling and is pretty sensitive and strong for it being a 4 piece. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great rod for any angler
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Only casting rod of its type that can fold into 4 pieces. Can support a fight with a decent sized fish too.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cheng

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: great travel rod , great value, i own 2 different rods from Fiblink
customer_reviews.author: Paul Deen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing travel rod!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing rod, has handled plenty of fish and it is amazing to travel with! Only thing to pay attention to is that the action is stiffer than the description. I have the 6.6 med and has the feel of a MH. But I can’t complain it has worked amazing for me.
customer_reviews.author: krist

customer_reviews.title: This is not a sturdy rod.
customer_reviews.text: I took it to New Zealand and the first time it got hung up in the bottom I pulled and the rod broke into three pieces, literally shattered into three pieces. Unless you are catching bluegill I wouldn’t buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Wilbur Graves

customer_reviews.title: This is a great rod. Same quality as a single piece rod ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rod. Same quality as a single piece rod and very good for bass. Fit easily in suit case. Saved my vac when my telescoping rod brake on first fish. I ordered this thru Amazon Prime and it was delivered to the resort the next day.
customer_reviews.author: rjbarker

customer_reviews.title: Great travel rod!
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with this rod. Casts extremely well if you stay within the design parameters for line and lure weight. Great bang for the buck. Used inshore for trout/reds and fresh water for bass. Worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable grip
customer_reviews.text: The grip is extremely comfortable with my diawa millionaire 300 on it (it’s a levelwind reel). The pieces are very secure when you put the rod together.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Great product better price!
customer_reviews.text: The action is a true MH with a fast tip, great as a versatile travel bass rod for most bass applications. Easily fits in a backpack or a suitcase. Was a little skeptical at he low price but the quality seems to be there and it's perfect for what I need it for. Will be purchasing the spinning version as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Lai

customer_reviews.title: Really like it!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice rod, a lot higher quality than most travel rods.
customer_reviews.author: WYCowboy65

customer_reviews.title: Too fragile
customer_reviews.text: First time I used the rod broke it’s too fragile
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Light, durable, transportable
customer_reviews.text: Really durable, i make some pretty violent casts. It fells really good and light. Been thinking about buying some more. Definitely something to consider when traveling far with rods.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Great travel rod
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 6'6 version.. like it.. light weight. Had no problem pulling in 3lb bass on Texas rig.. plenty of backbone.. would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble and has a good feel.
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this rod. We took two of these with us on our trip down to Table rock lake and they performed as well as I could have ever hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Soren

customer_reviews.title: He loved it! Very light weight and works well
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my son to take on the plane. He loved it! Very light weight and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: Best rod ever
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this rod I've been using it for everything it's amazing strong light weight and alot of hook setting power
customer_reviews.author: Dominick Stephens

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Rod tip broke on first use. I received a refund
customer_reviews.author: KAJ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it, exceptionally portable. Carried it in my carry on.
customer_reviews.author: Chillyqueen92

customer_reviews.title: Rod is a excellent travel casting rod
customer_reviews.text: Rod is a excellent travel casting rod. Recommend to anyone who wants to keep something in the car at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Cheap junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and the tip snapped very easily then I exchanged it and it broke again! It’s a cheap piece of junk 0/5 stars do no recommend at all!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Marcille

customer_reviews.title: Great rod!
customer_reviews.text: Great rod. Great quality especially for the price. Good rod for 8-15# test.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Toorop

customer_reviews.title: Pole arrived with the tip broken. It was a ...
customer_reviews.text: Pole arrived with the tip broken. It was a gift for a friend, and now they cannot take it on their upcoming trip. Very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: good value travel rod
customer_reviews.text: for the price, it is very good. I have not caught fish with it, but I tried to cast out few times, it was pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: James Zou

customer_reviews.title: Broke after two uses
customer_reviews.text: Great portability, great price... unfortunately not very strong. I fixed it as the picture shows, but honestly I shouldn’t have to fix it after the second use.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: Tip of rod broke on first use. Definitely light weight and good for travel but couldn't handle a 3lb catfish.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Strong and sturdy, and travel friendly too. Paired excellently with a Abu Garcia Revo SXHS reel.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good rod.
customer_reviews.text: I caught 12 fish in Florida with this bad boy.
customer_reviews.author: Meridith Bihuniak

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I'm always iffy whenever I buy something online about how it will turn out in person, especially a fishing rod. When this rod came in I was surprised by how good of a rod it is. It's a good product and I would definitely buy it again if I had the choice
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Tip broke off.
customer_reviews.text: Tip broke off after a few uses. Very disappointed with the product.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Great rod, preformed better than I thought it would
customer_reviews.text: Needed it for travel. Great rod, preformed better than I thought it would. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Taulbee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems awesome so far. Bought for vacation fishing on beach. Will update after traveling and fighting redfish...
customer_reviews.author: Brad Hammonds

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rod Handled Bone fish
customer_reviews.text: Awesome rod Handled Bone fish, Snook and a HUGE Permit, with out any Issues. Fits inside checked luggage with out a problem. Assembled in seconds and ready to fish.
customer_reviews.author: Danette

customer_reviews.title: Great travel rod
customer_reviews.text: Great rod worth the money caught a jack crevalle and a few largemouth so far on it. I give it 4 stars because the rod was shipped with no protection in the box and a few guides were slightly bent not sure from shipping or manufacturing I was able to bend them back with no issues I'd appreciate bubble wrap or something next time.
customer_reviews.author: Rtb2

customer_reviews.title: Better then expected - ordered the spinning rod to match
customer_reviews.text: I just want to echo what others have said - for the price the cork is awesome and the rod is much nicer then I had expected so nice I ordered the spinning version as well. For a travel rod in this price I don't think it can be beat. I also fly fish and am familiar with fishing multi secion rods you need to check the section seating especially if your in warmer climates or fishing where you have temp swings. It fits easily in my roll abroad for travel
customer_reviews.author: ZVF

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Rod was very sensitive and performed excellently. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best rod for the price in a travel rod I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best rod for the price in a travel rod I found online. Most are $80 to $100! It's a little stiff for small trout but should be great for salmon. I'm happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Bought for pike fishing
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 7' casting and spinning rods for a trip to NW Manitoba pike fishing. These rods held up catching several dozen pike per day, up to and including a 41" monster. No rod related failure of ANY kind. I would recommend for any freshwater fishing you had in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't fish off of a pier
customer_reviews.text: Snapped after reeling in 7 consecutive flounder while fishing on cocoa beach pier. Convienent rod for travelling but a four piece rod just can't compare to a 1 or 2 piece. Giving this product a few stars because it did give me a few days of enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: RitaRita

customer_reviews.title: Great travelling rod
customer_reviews.text: I bought this since I travel full time, and this is a perfect size for my RV when broken down. Good action and a very economical price.
customer_reviews.author: K. Butterfield

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: High quality and great looking fishing rod. Everything aligned perfectly and it handled several 8 pound bass so far. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: It is stiff for its rating but quite perfectly balanced and sits in hand very nicely. It is now my preferred rod and I ...
customer_reviews.text: Very light yet thick walled blank. Today got a striper on this rod. Sensitivity is beyond belief. It is stiff for its rating but quite perfectly balanced and sits in hand very nicely. It is now my preferred rod and I have much more expensive rods.
customer_reviews.author: ILYA KARETSKY

customer_reviews.title: great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this rod so I can take it with me anywhere. Rod feels great for being 4 pieces. Currently using it with 15lb mono and sensitivity is good for a travel rod. Only downside is the case it comes with is not protective at all.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E.

customer_reviews.title: broke on 2 ib bass sucks
customer_reviews.text: i was flipping the bass to my rock with my hand in the middle of the rod stupid thing brakes in two places
customer_reviews.author: kylemarek

customer_reviews.title: Overall it is a good quality build but I had couple of things that ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall it is a good quality build but I had couple of things that I did not like The good: 4 piece travel Rod is straight Guide Aligned correctly I like the light build with cork handle The bad: Joint areas are questionable and I had to sand it down a bit to cover the joint area where it is not visible Little bit too stiff for medium heavy
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great rod and plenty stiff well made very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST ROD EVER
customer_reviews.text: This rod is very strong, and seems great for it's price point. I haven't tested it really yet, but updates will come soon!
customer_reviews.author: Ming Le Cai

product_meta.title: Fiblink 4 Pieces Travel Casting Rod Carbon Baitcasting Fishing Rod Portable Fishing Rod Baitcaster
feature_bullets: Sensitive and Solid Carbon Fiber Construction - Enhanced sensitivity of carbon composite rod. The rod delivers the extraordinary toughness of solid carbon fiber construction and precisely tuned action. Light weight with tremendous overall strength, though and strong solid carbon fiber construction, maximizes strength while maintaining sensitivity.

High-Quality Guides - 7+1 guides with stainless steel frames and ceramic inserts. Stainless steel mixed with ceramic guide makes it more smooth, aviods line stucking in the guides, minimize friction for smooth, long casts, while also enhancing sensitivity by transferring vibrations from the line through the guide to the rod and to your hand.
Portable Design - 4-piece design & Durable rod protect bag make it easy to carry. Great for carrying out and having a fishing trip. A multi-purpose hook holder, effective hook keeper.
Extreme Exposure Reel Seat - Enhanced reel seat with corrosion resistant stainless steel hoods.

Ultra-premium-grade cork grip - Non slip high density cork handle and foregrips; Handles and butts grips that provide comfort and a sure grip in all conditions. Durable cork grips offer light weight and all day comfort.
